items.content:

355:

358: - Square root regularization σ'_reg(σ²) = √(σ² + ε_σ²): Real analytic on ℝ_{≥0}

items.label: rmk-k-uniformity-mechanism-cinf
items.title: k-Uniformity Mechanism
items.content:
406: :label: rmk-k-uniformity-mechanism-cinf
407: 
408: The k-uniformity proven in C³ ([13_geometric_gas_c3_regularity.md](13_geometric_gas_c3_regularity.md) § 5.2, Lemmas 5.2-5.3) and C⁴ ([14_geometric_gas_c4_regularity.md](14_geometric_gas_c4_regularity.md) § 5, Lemmas 5.1-5.2) relies on the telescoping identity:
409: 
410: $$
411: \sum_{j \in A_k} \nabla^m w_{ij}(\rho) = 0 \quad \text{for all } m \geq 1
412: $$
413: 
414: This follows from differentiating ∑_j w_ij = 1 identically. The consequence is that sums like ∑_j ∇^m w_ij · d(x_j) can be rewritten as **centered sums**:
415: 
416: $$
417: \sum_j \nabla^m w_{ij} \cdot d(x_j) = \sum_j \nabla^m w_{ij} \cdot (d(x_j) - \mu_\rho)
418: $$
419: 
420: Since |d(x_j) - μ_ρ| ≤ diam(d) is uniformly bounded (X is compact), the sum scales as O(||∇^m w_ij||), not O(k · ||∇^m w_ij||). This prevents linear growth in k and ensures k-uniformity.

items.label: rmk-factorial-no-explosion
items.title: Why Factorial Growth Doesn't Explode
items.content:
679: :label: rmk-factorial-no-explosion
680: 
681: The potential concern is that iterating the Faà di Bruno formula m times could yield (m!)^m growth. This doesn't happen because:
682: 
683: 1. **Telescoping cancellation**: The centered sums ∑_j ∇^m w_ij · (d_j - μ_ρ) have leading-order terms that cancel, preventing naive k · (m!) growth
684: 2. **Partition combinatorics**: The Bell polynomial coefficients C_Bell(m, p) count set partitions, growing as B_m ~ (m/log m)^m < m! but with favorable structure for our quotient
685: 3. **Hermite sub-factorial bounds**: |H_m(y)| · e^{-y²/2} ≤ C · √(m!), not m!, provides a "cushion" against exponential blowup
686: 4. **Empirical verification**: C³ and C⁴ exhibit single-factorial growth, confirming the pattern

items.label: rmk-gevrey-not-analytic-cinf
items.title: Why Gevrey-1, Not Real Analytic?
items.content:
794: :label: rmk-gevrey-not-analytic-cinf
795: 
796: Despite the Gaussian kernel being real analytic, V_fit fails real analyticity due to:
797: 
798: 1. **Variable alive set**: The sum ∑_{j ∈ A_k} involves k-dependent number of terms, where k changes as walkers die. Not a finite composition of analytic functions.
799: 
800: 2. **Normalization non-analyticity**: w_ij = K_ij / (∑_ℓ K_iℓ) has denominator depending on alive set. While smooth, may fail holomorphic extension if zeros of denominator cluster near real axis.
801: 
802: 3. **Hermite polynomial growth**: Bounds |H_m(y)| ~ √(m!) are **sub-factorial**, insufficient to guarantee Taylor series convergence.
